alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 9:20PM EDT until August 14 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM SATURDAY TO 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Up to one and a half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline for tonight and Saturday night high tides. * WHERE...Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, until midnight EDT tonight. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 PM Saturday to 1 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional minor flooding is possible Sunday Night. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. ROCKAWAY INLET NY NEAR FLOYD BENNETT FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.3 FT, MODERATE 8.3 FT, MAJOR 9.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/09 PM 7.3/ 7.8 1.7/ 2.2 0.6/ 1.1 1 MINOR 13/09 AM 6.1/ 6.6 0.5/ 1.0 0.4/ 0.9 1 NONE 13/09 PM 7.1/ 7.6 1.5/ 2.0 0.9/ 1.4 1 MINOR 14/10 AM 6.2/ 6.7 0.6/ 1.1 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE JAMAICA BAY AT INWOOD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
